Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the surface of the interior has flaked away in a number of places, the exterior, which has also flaked away in a number of places, is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394695) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394695)
